results.title: The Spring and fall of Nina Polanski
results.creator_credit: Kathleen Shannon, Louise Roy, Joan Hutton and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
An animation film depicting the life of a certain Nina Polanski, who could be any woman. She marries amidst much fanfare and photo-snapping, and settles into a domestic routine of cooking, washing dishes, ironing, and babies. Eventually she becomes the very machines she uses every day, until one day she walks into the woods and takes back her old self.
results.title_for_label: The Spring and fall of Nina Polanski
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kathleen Shannon, Louise Roy, Joan Hutton and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Sport parade: sport spellbinders
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items featuring a variety of sports including: 1. The sport of fishing turned commercial - tuna fishing off the Galapagos Islands. 2. Action over the high hurdles, obstacle race, broad-jump, high jump, polevault (photography showing athletes in slow-motion). 3. Skiing on the sand, water skiing in Florida’s Biscayne Bay. 4. Sports in the Maine Woods - kayaks shoot the rapids of a roaring mountain stream, flat-bottome boats. 5. Outboard motor boats racing at high speeds. 6. The sport of kings - a steeplechase race. 7. Motorcycle race up a hill to the top. 8. Jalopy Derby free for all.

results.title: The Sport parade: ski revels
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine item about life on a ski field, from the snowplows that clear the roads to the field through to the actual skiing. Shows amateurs and professionals, old-fashioned horse drawn skiing, modern ski lifts, skiing with wings (ie for transport) and the practical uses of skiing.

results.title: The Spongers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Tony Garnett, British Broadcasting Corporation and Roland Joffe
results.brief_description: A play written by Jim Allen and set during the 1977 Silver Jubilee. Britain seems to be in a state of rejoicing, and there seems to be plenty of money to spend on the festivities, but Pauline has nothing to cheer about. She has four children, the eldest is a Downs Syndrome child, she has no income and because of the family cannot go out to work. In theory the social service exists to help those in such situations. In practice there are tribunals, councils and welfare departments to be faced.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Garnett, British Broadcasting Corporation and Roland Joffe
